article_title: Otter unveils new plan to address coverage gap
article_text: Idaho Gov. C.L. "Butch" Otter speaks to reporters about the upcoming 2016 legislative session at the State Capitol building on Thursday, Jan. 7, 2016 in Boise, Idaho. The new session begins Monday, Jan. 11. (AP Photo/Otto Kitsinger)

article_metadata.description: BOISE — Gov. C. L. “Butch” Otter announced a new $30 million program on Thursday that would provide coverage for basic medical care to nearly 78,000 Idahoans caught in a gap where they neither qualify for health insurance subsidies or Medicaid.

og.description: BOISE — Gov. C. L. “Butch” Otter announced a new $30 million program on Thursday that would provide coverage for basic medical care to nearly 78,000 Idahoans caught in a gap where they neither qualify for health insurance subsidies or Medicaid.
og.title: Otter unveils new plan to address coverage gap

article_summary:
"Butch" Otter speaks to reporters about the upcoming 2016 legislative session at the State Capitol building on Thursday, Jan. 7, 2016 in Boise, Idaho.
The new session begins Monday, Jan. 11.
(AP Photo/Otto Kitsinger)
